Data.event_text: 8 September  MPs vote in favour of the government's NHS and social care tax rise plan by 319 votes to 248, a majority of 71.

links.text: -"Social care tax rise: Boris Johnson wins Commons vote". BBC News. 8 September 2021. Retrieved 8 September 2021.-

Data.event_text: 9 September  COVID-19 vaccination in the UK The JCVI approves the use of the PfizerBioNTech and Oxfordâ€“AstraZeneca vaccines as COVID-19 booster shots, paving the way for a rollout ahead of the winter.

links.text: -"Covid: Pfizer and AstraZeneca approved as booster vaccines". BBC News. 9 September 2021. Retrieved 9 September 2021.-

Data.event_text: 11 September  British player Emma Raducanu wins the 2021 US Open Women's Singles on her first attempt. Raducanu becomes the first qualifier in history, male or female, to win a Grand Slam tournament and the first female British player to win a major since Virginia Wade at Wimbledon in 1977. She also won the tournament without losing a set. She is the second British player to do this male or female after Angela Mortimer Barrett at the 1958 Australian Championships.

links.text: -"Raducanu 'outstanding' â€“ the Queen". BBC Sport. Retrieved 12 September 2021.-

Data.event_text: 12 September  COVID-19 in the UK A plan for vaccine passports in England is ditched by the government, but kept "in reserve" should it be needed over autumn or winter.

links.text: -"England vaccine passport plans ditched, Sajid Javid says". BBC News. 12 September 2021. Retrieved 12 September 2021.-

Data.event_text: 13 September  COVID-19 vaccination in the UK The UK's four chief medical officers recommend that children aged 1215 should be vaccinated against COVID-19, initially with a single dose, leaving the possibility for a second dose in spring 2022.

links.text: -"UK children aged 12 to 15 to be offered Covid jab". The Guardian. 13 September 2021. Retrieved 13 September 2021.-

Data.event_text: 14 September  COVID-19 vaccination in the UK The JCVI recommends a booster shot against COVID-19 for the over 50s and at-risk groups, preferably the PfizerBioNTech vaccine, meaning about 30 million adults should receive a third dose.

links.text: -"Covid boosters can be offered to all UK over-50s, watchdog confirms". The Guardian. 14 September 2021. Retrieved 14 September 2021.-

Data.event_text: The Consumer Price Index jumps from 2 to 3.2%, its biggest increase since 1997.

links.text: -"Price rises see record jump as food costs soar in August". BBC News. 15 September 2021. Retrieved 15 September 2021.-

Data.event_text: Johnson reshuffles the cabinet. Dominic Raab is appointed Deputy Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.

links.text: -"Reshuffle: Boris Johnson fires Gavin Williamson as he rings cabinet changes". BBC News. 15 September 2021. Retrieved 15 September 2021.-

Data.event_text: The UK joins AUKUS, a trilateral security pact with Australia and the United States, to counter the influence of China.

links.text: -"US, UK and Australia forge military alliance to counter China". The Guardian. 16 September 2021. Retrieved 16 September 2021.-

Data.event_text: COVID-19 vaccination in the UK The booster programme begins in England and Wales, starting with NHS staff.

links.text: -"First Covid booster jabs given to NHS staff". BBC News. 16 September 2021. Retrieved 16 September 2021.-

Data.event_text: Co-op Food announces a partnership with Amazon Prime, enabling same-day grocery deliveries, while also expanding the use of robots from 200 to 500 units.

links.text: -"Co-op to start selling groceries on Amazon Prime". BBC News. 16 September 2021. Retrieved 16 September 2021.-

Data.event_text: 18 September  Princess Beatrice gives birth to her first child, a baby girl.

links.text: -"Princess Beatrice gives birth to a girl". BBC News. 20 September 2021. Retrieved 20 September 2021.-

Data.event_text: Business Secretary Kwasi Kwarteng holds crisis talks with industry bosses, as firms struggle to stay afloat amid a surge in natural gas wholesale prices.

links.text: -"Gas firms seek help amid higher energy bill fears". BBC News. 20 September 2021. Retrieved 20 September 2021.-
-"No 10 dismisses 'winter of discontent' warnings amid energy crisis talks". The Guardian. 20 September 2021. Retrieved 20 September 2021.-

Data.event_text: The Northern line extension to Battersea opens, the first major expansion of the London Underground in over 20 years.

links.text: -"Northern line extension: Two new Tube stations open". BBC News. 20 September 2021. Retrieved 20 September 2021.-

Data.event_text: 23 September  The government announces plans to prevent employers in the hospitality industry from withholding tips given by customers to staff.Empty pumps during the Autumn fuel panic on 25 September

links.text: -"Restaurants set to be banned from withholding staff tips". BBC News. 23 September 2021. Retrieved 24 September 2021.-

Data.event_text: 26 September  2021 fuel supply crisis Amid panic buying at petrol stations, ministers suspend competition laws to enable fuel suppliers to talk to one another and prioritise locations most in need.

links.text: -"Fuel supply: UK suspends competition law to get petrol to forecourts". BBC News. 26 September 2021. Retrieved 26 September 2021.-

Data.event_text: 27 September  2021 fuel supply crisis 50% to 90% of fuel stations in some regions of England have run dry, according to Petrol Retailers Association (PRA) members.
Katie Price is hospitalised after a car crash in Horsham. The following day, she pleads guilty to three charges of drunk driving, driving without insurance and driving while disqualified.

links.text: -"Katie Price admits to Sussex car crash while drink-driving". BBC News. 29 September 2021. Retrieved 29 September 2021.-

Data.event_text: The United Kingdom's international vehicle registration code is officially changed from "GB" to "UK", after more than 110 years.

links.text: -"GB number plate sticker no longer valid abroad". BBC News. 29 September 2021. Retrieved 30 September 2021.-

Data.event_text: 2021 fuel supply crisis Businesses involved in the fuel industry issue a joint statement saying that they are "now seeing signs that the situation at the pumps has begun to improve".
Labour leader Keir Starmer gives his first in-person speech at the party's annual conference.

links.text: -"Starmer delivers speech to Labour conference". BBC News. 29 September 2021. Retrieved 29 September 2021.-

Data.event_text: Former police officer Wayne Couzens, who pleaded guilty to the murder of Sarah Everard, is sentenced at the Old Bailey to a whole-life tariff. Lord Justice Fulford calls the case "devastating, tragic and wholly brutal" and tells Couzens he has eroded public confidence in the police.

links.text: -"Sarah Everard's killer sentenced live: Wayne Couzens's lawyer says he's 'full of self-loathing' as he appears in court for sentence". Sky News. 30 September 2021. Retrieved 30 September 2021.-
-"Sarah Everard murder: Wayne Couzens given whole-life sentence". BBC News. 30 September 2021. Retrieved 30 September 2021.-

Data.event_text: The UK Government announces the establishment of a Household Support Fund, to be administered by local councils and available from 6 October onwards.

links.text: -UK Government, Household Support Fund: guidance for local councils, published on 11 November 2021, accessed on 15 March 2025-

Data.event_text: 5 October  Flooding hits parts of London following torrential rain overnight, with Knightsbridge and Kensington particularly badly affected.

links.text: -"London flooding hits Tube services and roads". BBC News. 5 October 2021. Retrieved 5 October 2021.-

Data.event_text: The Â£20 weekly increase to Universal Credit is withdrawn, 18 months after its introduction.

links.text: -"Universal credit reduction: 'I feel overwhelmed' at financial impact". BBC News. 6 October 2021. Retrieved 6 October 2021.-

Data.event_text: Amazon opens its first non-food store in the UK, at Bluewater Shopping Centre near Dartford.

links.text: -"Amazon opens first UK non-food store". BBC News. 6 October 2021. Retrieved 6 October 2021.-

Data.event_text: Boris Johnson delivers his speech to the Conservative Party Conference in Manchester, his first in-person address to Tory members since the COVID-19 pandemic.

links.text: -"Boris Johnson: It is our mission as Tories to promote opportunity". BBC News. 6 October 2021. Retrieved 6 October 2021.-

Data.event_text: The natural gas trading price rises to its highest ever level, increasing by 37% in the morning, recovering later in the day to finish 9% down on the day's starting price.

links.text: -"Firms urge help as gas prices soar to record high". BBC News. 6 October 2021. Retrieved 6 October 2021.-
-Sheppard, David; Hume, Neil; Seddon, Max; Brower, Derek (6 October 2021). "Gas markets whipsaw after Russia offers to stabilise energy prices". Financial Times. Retrieved 7 October 2021.-

Data.event_text: 7 October  After an agreement fell through in 2020 with owner Mike Ashley, Saudi-led consortium Public Investment Fund buys 80% of Newcastle United's shares worth Â£300m, making Newcastle the richest British football club, surpassing Manchester City.

links.text: -"Newcastle United Q&A: who is taking over and why are they controversial?". The Guardian. 7 October 2021. Retrieved 8 October 2021.-

Data.event_text: 9 October  COVID-19 vaccination in the UK The number of people receiving a third vaccine dose exceeds 2 million.

links.text: -"More than 2 million people in England have had Covid booster jab". The Guardian. 9 October 2021. Retrieved 9 October 2021.-

Data.event_text: 10 October  The four remaining cooling towers at Eggborough Power Station are demolished with explosives.
11 October  A question on sexual activities in areas with widespread HIV transmission will be removed following recommendations to make blood donation inclusive.

links.text: -"Blood donation to be made more inclusive". Gov.UK. 11 October 2021. Retrieved 7 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: 12 October  COVID-19 in the UK A joint report from the Health & Social Care and Science and Technology Select Committee describes the decisions on lockdowns and social distancing during the early weeks of the pandemic, and the advice that led to them, as "one of the most important public health failures the UK has ever experienced", and the vaccination approach, including its research, development, and rollout as "one of the most effective initiatives in UK history".

links.text: -"Covid: UK's early response worst public health failure ever, MPs say". BBC News. 12 October 2021. Retrieved 12 October 2021.-

Data.event_text: In a BBC interview about the Earthshot Prize, Prince William talks about "climate anxiety" among younger generations, and suggests that rich entrepreneurs should be "trying to repair this planet, not trying to find the next place to go and live".

links.text: -"Prince William: Saving Earth should come before space tourism". BBC News. 14 October 2021. Retrieved 14 October 2021.-

Data.event_text: North Yorkshire Police, Fire and Crime Commissioner Philip Allott resigns following comments surrounding the murder of Sarah Everard.

links.text: -"Sarah Everard: Commissioner Philip Allott resigns". BBC News. 14 October 2021. Retrieved 15 October 2021.-

Data.event_text: Conservative MP Sir David Amess dies after being stabbed multiple times during his constituency surgery at Belfairs Methodist Church in Leigh-on-Sea. Police arrest a 25-year-old male British national, and treat the killing as an act of terror.

links.text: -"Conservative MP Sir David Amess stabbed multiple times in incident at constituency surgery". Sky News. 15 October 2021. Retrieved 15 October 2021.-
-"Sir David Amess killing was terrorism, police say". BBC News. 16 October 2021. Retrieved 16 October 2021.-

Data.event_text: COVID-19 in the UK NHS Test and Trace suspends testing provided by a private laboratory in Wolverhampton amid fears up to 43,000 people were given the wrong result for COVID-19 tests. The Health Security Agency announces it will hold a 'serious incident investigation' into the matter.

links.text: -"Serious incident investigation after wrong Covid results". BBC News. 15 October 2021. Retrieved 15 October 2021.-

Data.event_text: The contactless payment limit is increased from Â£45 to Â£100.

links.text: -"Shoppers start to use new Â£100 contactless payment limit". BBC News. 15 October 2021. Retrieved 15 October 2021.-

Data.event_text: 18 October  A minute's silence is held for Sir David Amess in the House of Commons. Boris Johnson pays tribute to Amess and announces that Southend-on-Sea will become a city, a status which the murdered MP had long campaigned for.

links.text: -"Southend to become city in memory of Sir David Amess". BBC News. 18 October 2021. Retrieved 18 October 2021.-

Data.event_text: Tesco opens its first checkout-free store, known as GetGo, similar in format to the automated Amazon Go stores.

links.text: -"Tesco opens its first checkout-free store". BBC News. 19 October 2021. Retrieved 19 October 2021.-

Data.event_text: The government announces grants of Â£5,000 to replace old gas boilers with heat pumps and other low-carbon technology, as part of its plan to phase out the sale of new gas boilers by 2035. Experts criticise the plans as unambitious, given that only 90,000 heat pumps will be installed over three years, out of 25 million homes with gas boilers.

links.text: -"Heat pump grants worth Â£5,000 to help replace gas boilers". BBC News. 19 October 2021. Retrieved 19 October 2021.-

Data.event_text: 20 October  COVID-19 in the UK In a Downing Street press conference, Sajid Javid announces the securing of two new antiviral drug deals for the UK. He warns that daily case numbers could reach 100,000 and urges the public to remain cautious.

links.text: -"Sajid Javid announces UK has secured new antiviral drug deals". The Standard. 21 October 2021. Retrieved 21 October 2021.-

Data.event_text: With daily infections above 40,000 for eight consecutive days, the British Medical Association accuses the government of being "wilfully negligent" for not reimposing rules such as mandatory face masks.

links.text: -"Covid: Doctors call for Covid Plan B to start in England". BBC News. 21 October 2021. Retrieved 21 October 2021.-

Data.event_text: The number of daily infections exceeds 50,000 for the first time since July.

links.text: -"Covid: UK cases top 50,000 for first time in three months". BBC News. 21 October 2021. Retrieved 21 October 2021.-

Data.event_text: 24 October  COVID-19 vaccination in the UK The number of people receiving a third vaccine dose exceeds 5 million. The NHS reports 325,000 booster jabs administered on Saturday, a new record number.

links.text: -"COVID-19: Record number of coronavirus booster jabs administered â€“ with 800,000 given in past 72 hours". Sky News. 24 October 2021. Retrieved 24 October 2021.-

Data.event_text: 25 October  London's Ultra Low Emission Zone is expanded by 18 times, to include the area within the North and South Circular Roads.

links.text: -"London's Ulez made 18 times bigger with thousands of drivers facing daily charge". Metro. 25 October 2021. Retrieved 25 October 2021.-

Data.event_text: 26 October  Following a recent overnight stay in hospital, Buckingham Palace confirms that the Queen will be unable to attend the upcoming COP26 climate change conference in Glasgow.

links.text: -"Queen to miss Cop26 climate conference in Glasgow". The Guardian. 26 October 2021. Retrieved 27 October 2021.-

Data.event_text: Police make 31 arrests as members of Insulate Britain glue themselves to roads around London and Kent.

links.text: -"Insulate Britain attacked with ink as they block A40 in west London and roundabout in Dartford". Evening Standard. 27 October 2021. Retrieved 27 October 2021.-

Data.event_text: The Budget Chancellor Rishi Sunak presents his autumn statement, designed to help the UK emerge from the COVID-19 pandemic. This includes a Â£150bn increase in departmental spending, an increase in the National Living Wage from Â£8.91 to Â£9.50, a cut in the Universal Credit taper rate from 63% to 55%, and the biggest cut to business rates in over 30 years.

links.text: -"Budget 2021: key points at a glance". The Guardian. 27 October 2021. Retrieved 27 October 2021.-
-"Autumn Budget 2021: Key points at-a-glance". BBC News. 27 October 2021. Retrieved 27 October 2021.-

Data.event_text: COVID-19 in the UK Labour leader Keir Starmer goes into self-isolation after testing positive for coronavirus. Shadow Chancellor Rachel Reeves takes his place at the despatch box in the House of Commons.

links.text: -"Budget 2021: Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer misses debate after positive Covid test". BBC News. 27 October 2021. Retrieved 27 October 2021.-

Data.event_text: At the Old Bailey, Danyal Hussein is sentenced to a minimum of 35 years in prison for the murders of Bibaa Henry and Nicole Smallman, two sisters he stabbed to death at random in Wembley Park.

links.text: -"Killer who murdered 2 sisters in park after 'pact with demon' jailed for 35 years". Mirror. 28 October 2021. Retrieved 28 October 2021.-
-"Wembley park killings: Danyal Hussein jailed for life for murdering sisters". BBC News. 28 October 2021. Retrieved 28 October 2021.-

Data.event_text: Sidney Cooke, 94, one of the UK's most notorious paedophiles and serial killers, is denied parole for the tenth time. Cooke was jailed for life with a minimum five-year term in 1999 for the abuse of two brothers.

links.text: -"Sidney Cooke: Notorious paedophile denied parole for 10th time". BBC News. 28 October 2021. Retrieved 6 November 2021.-

Data.event_text: Twelve people are injured following a rail crash in Salisbury, Wiltshire.

links.text: -"Salisbury train crash: Major incident as two trains collide". BBC News. 31 October 2021. Retrieved 31 October 2021.-
-"Two trains crash near Salisbury station â€“ with emergency services at the scene". Sky News. Retrieved 31 October 2021.-

Data.event_text: The two-week United Nations Climate Change Conference (COP26) is held in Glasgow, after being postponed in 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic. A deal is agreed by world leaders, which includes a "phasedown" of unabated coal power, a 30% cut in methane emissions by 2030, plans for a halt to deforestation by 2030, and increased financial support for developing countries.

links.text: -"Glasgow Climate Change Conference". United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change.-
-"What is COP26 and what has been agreed at Glasgow climate conference?". BBC News. 14 November 2021. Retrieved 14 November 2021.-
-"COP26 Reaches Consensus on Key Actions to Address Climate Change". UN. 13 November 2021. Retrieved 14 November 2021.-

Data.event_text: 3 November  After the Parliamentary Commissioner for Standards found that Conservative MP Owen Paterson breached lobbying rules, with a recommended 30-day suspension, the House of Commons votes by 250 to 232 to postpone the decision whilst a review of the investigating watchdog is undertaken.

links.text: -"Owen Paterson: Anger as Tory MP avoids suspension in rule shake-up". BBC News. 3 November 2021. Retrieved 3 November 2021.-
-"Tory MP avoids suspension after Boris Johnson intervenes in sleaze row". The Guardian. 3 November 2021. Retrieved 3 November 2021.-

Data.event_text: Owen Paterson steps down as an MP after 24 years in politics, calling the past two years "an indescribable nightmare for my family and me".

links.text: -"Owen Paterson quits as MP over lobbying row 'nightmare'". BBC News. 4 November 2021. Retrieved 4 November 2021.-

Data.event_text: Former Labour MP Claudia Webbe is given a 10-week sentence, suspended for two years, after being convicted of harassment.

links.text: -"Claudia Webbe: MP convicted of harassment gets suspended sentence". BBC News. 4 November 2021. Retrieved 4 November 2021.-

Data.event_text: Leader of the House, Jacob Rees-Mogg, announces that the planned overhaul of the standards system will not, in fact, go ahead without cross-party support.

links.text: -"Government to rethink MPs' conduct plan after backlash". BBC News. 4 November 2021. Retrieved 4 November 2021.-
-"Boris Johnson makes U-turn over anti-sleaze regime for MPs". The Guardian. 4 November 2021. Retrieved 4 November 2021.-

Data.event_text: COVID-19 in the UK The UK becomes the first country in the world to approve molnupiravir, an oral antiviral pill for COVID-19 that cuts the risk of hospitalisation or death by half.

links.text: -"First pill to treat Covid gets approval in UK". BBC News. 4 November 2021. Retrieved 4 November 2021.-

Data.event_text: 7 November  COVID-19 vaccination in the UK The number of people receiving a third vaccine dose exceeds 10 million.

links.text: -"Covid: Ten million boosters now given in UK but more needed â€“ PM". BBC News. 7 November 2021. Retrieved 7 November 2021.-

Data.event_text: 9 November  Footballer Marcus Rashford is awarded an MBE for his campaigning to help vulnerable children.

links.text: -"Marcus Rashford: Manchester United striker to give MBE to mum". BBC News. 9 November 2021. Retrieved 9 November 2021.-

Data.event_text: 11 November  A record daily number of migrant crossings between France and the UK is reported, with around 1,000 people intercepted by border patrols. The cumulative total of 23,000 for the year is far higher than previous years.

links.text: -"Number of migrants crossing Channel to UK hits new daily record". BBC News. 12 November 2021. Retrieved 12 November 2021.-

Data.event_text: The Queen expresses her "great regret" at missing the Remembrance Sunday service at the Cenotaph in London after spraining her back.

links.text: -"Queen misses Remembrance Sunday service after back sprain". BBC News. 14 November 2021. Retrieved 14 November 2021.-

Data.event_text: COVID-19 vaccination in the UK The number of children aged between 12 and 15 having received a first vaccine dose exceeds one million.

links.text: -"Covid vaccines: NHS jabs more than 1m children aged 12â€“15 in England". BBC News. 14 November 2021. Retrieved 14 November 2021.-

Data.event_text: COP26 Following the conclusion of the UN Climate Change Conference in Glasgow, Boris Johnson appears at No 10 for a press conference with Alok Sharma. He describes the deal secured by world leaders as a "game-changing agreement" which sounds "the death knell for coal power".

links.text: -"PM and Sharma speaking after climate deal agreed". BBC News. 14 November 2021. Retrieved 14 November 2021.-

Data.event_text: Three men are arrested under the Terrorism Act after a car explodes outside Liverpool Women's Hospital, killing one man and injuring another.

links.text: -"Liverpool explosion: Three arrested under Terrorism Act after car blast at hospital". BBC News. 14 November 2021. Retrieved 14 November 2021.-

Data.event_text: The UK terror threat level is raised from substantial to severe, meaning an attack is "highly likely", after the Liverpool Women's Hospital bombing.

links.text: -"Liverpool Women's Hospital explosion declared a terrorist incident". BBC News. 15 November 2021. Retrieved 15 November 2021.-

Data.event_text: COVID-19 vaccination in the UK The JCVI announces that the booster jab programme should be extended to those aged 40 to 49. It also recommends that 16 and 17 year olds, who were initially offered only a single dose, should now get a second.

links.text: -"Covid booster doses to be offered to over 40s". BBC News. 15 November 2021. Retrieved 15 November 2021.-

Data.event_text: 16 November  Ex-Yorkshire cricketer Azeem Rafiq tells the Culture and Sport Committee he was treated in an "inhuman" way by his club when his unborn son died, as he gives evidence to MPs about racism, saying it is "institutional in cricket".

links.text: -"Rafiq questioned by MPs on Yorkshire racism". BBC News. 16 November 2021. Retrieved 16 November 2021.-

Data.event_text: 17 November  The UK inflation rate hits 4.2%, its highest level for 10 years and more than double the Bank of England's target, driven mainly by higher fuel and energy prices.

links.text: -"Inflation: UK prices soar at fastest rate for almost ten years". BBC News. 17 November 2021. Retrieved 17 November 2021.-

Data.event_text: 18 November  High Speed 2 The government announces that the HS2 sections to Leeds from both the East Midlands and Manchester will be scrapped in favour of an earlier upgrade to the existing route between Manchester and Leeds. The transport secretary, Grant Shapps says the plan is "ambitious and unparalleled" and that it reduces journey times from Manchester to Leeds from 55 to 33 minutes, and from Birmingham to Nottingham by more than an hour to 26 minutes. The Â£96bn plans are criticised by shadow transport secretary, Jim McMahon, who says in the Commons that the government has broken its promise and "completely sold out" the north.

links.text: -"HS2 rail leg to Leeds scrapped, Grant Shapps confirms". The Guardian. 18 November 2021. Retrieved 18 November 2021.-

Data.event_text: 24 November   English Channel disaster An inflatable dinghy carrying 30 migrants capsizes while attempting to reach the UK from France, resulting in 27 deaths and one missing. The victims include a pregnant woman and three children. The incident is the deadliest of its kind on record.

links.text: -"Migrants deaths in Channel: 27 people die after migrant dinghy sinks off Calais â€“ five women and girl among victims". Sky News. Retrieved 25 November 2021.-

Data.event_text: The National Trust announces a ban on trail hunting on its land.

links.text: -"National Trust bans trail hunting on its land". BBC News. 25 November 2021. Retrieved 25 November 2021.-

Data.event_text: COVID-19 in the UK The UK becomes the fourth country to surpass 10 million COVID-19 cases after the United States, India and Brazil.

links.text: -"COVID-19: Total number of cases in UK passes 10 million since start of pandemic". Sky News.-

Data.event_text: Hamas is proscribed in its entirety as a terrorist organisation.

links.text: -"Islamist terrorist group Hamas banned in the UK". Gov.uk. 26 November 2021. Retrieved 26 November 2021.-

Data.event_text: A feasibility study into the proposed Irish Sea Bridge concludes that such a route is technically possible, but would cost up to Â£335bn and require 30 years to construct. A tunnel option is put at Â£209bn.

links.text: -"Boris Johnson's plan for Irish Sea bridge rejected over Â£335bn cost". The Guardian. 26 November 2021. Retrieved 26 November 2021.-
-"Fixed transport link between Great Britain and Northern Ireland: technical feasibility". Gov.uk. 26 November 2021. Retrieved 26 November 2021.-

Data.event_text: COVID-19 in the UK Amid international concerns over B.1.1.529, a highly mutated variant of COVID-19 that appears more infectious than Delta, six countries in Southern Africa are placed on the UK's travel red list. The government confirms that no cases have yet been detected in the UK.

links.text: -"New Covid variant: Javid says UK must act quickly over public health risk". BBC News. 26 November 2021. Retrieved 26 November 2021.-
-"Oral Statement on B.1.1.529 variant". Gov.uk. 26 November 2021. Retrieved 26 November 2021.-

Data.event_text: Two people are killed as Storm Arwen hits the British Isles. Widespread damage and travel disruption is reported in Scotland and North East England, with 100,000 people losing power.

links.text: -"Storm Arwen: Tributes after Francis Lagan killed by falling tree". BBC News. 27 November 2021. Retrieved 27 November 2021.-

Data.event_text: 27 November  COVID-19 in the UK Two cases of B.1.1.529, now designated by the WHO as the Omicron variant, are reported in the UK. Johnson holds a press conference at Downing Street with Sir Patrick Vallance and Professor Chris Whitty, in which the public are told that all international arrivals entering England must take a PCR test and self-isolate until they receive a negative result, while all contacts of suspected Omicron cases must self-isolate for 10 days, regardless of their vaccination status. It is also announced that face coverings will become compulsory on public transport and in shops (excluding hospitality) from 30 November.

links.text: -"Covid: Two cases of new variant Omicron detected in UK". BBC News. 27 November 2021. Retrieved 28 November 2021.-
-"Boris Johnson says anyone arriving in UK must take PCR test". YouTube. 27 November 2021. Retrieved 28 November 2021.-

Data.event_text: 30 November  The Queen congratulates Barbados as it becomes a republic, meaning she is no longer its head of state. The country remains part of the Commonwealth of Nations.

links.text: -"Queen congratulates Barbados as it becomes a republic". The Guardian. 30 November 2021. Retrieved 30 November 2021.-

Data.event_text: 1 December  The British Armed Forces announces that it will now allow those with HIV and taking antiretrovirals to serve, with those diagnosed to be allowed without restrictions from spring 2022, ending a barrier for such individuals. Medications will also be freely available for such personnel.

links.text: -"Armed Forces make major changes to end HIV being a barrier to service". Gov.UK. 1 December 2021. Retrieved 2 December 2021.-
-"HIV: People with virus or taking PrEP to be allowed to join armed forces". BBC. 1 December 2021. Retrieved 2 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: 2 December  COVID-19 vaccination in the UK The government orders 114 million more doses, 60 million of the Moderna vaccine and 54 million of the PfizerBioNTech COVID-19 vaccine, to use in 2022 and 2023.

links.text: -"UK orders 114m vaccine doses for next two years". BBC News. 2 December 2021. Retrieved 2 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: Emma Tustin and Thomas Hughes are jailed over the torture and killing of Hughes' six-year-old son, Arthur Labinjo-Hughes. Hughes, found guilty of his manslaughter, is jailed for 21 years. His partner Tustin, found guilty of murdering the boy, receives a minimum of 29 years.

links.text: -"Couple who killed Arthur Labinjo-Hughes jailed". BBC News. 3 December 2021. Retrieved 3 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: COVID-19 in the UK The number of confirmed cases of Omicron in the UK exceeds 100. The Health Security Agency publishes a risk assessment of the new variant.

links.text: -"COVID-19: 75 more Omicron cases found in England â€“ as UKHSA releases risk assessment". Sky News. 3 December 2021. Retrieved 4 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: 4 December  The Attorney-General announces a review of the sentences given to Emma Tustin and Thomas Hughes to "determine whether they were too low".

links.text: -"Arthur Labinjo-Hughes: Jail terms of boy's killers to be reviewed". BBC News. 4 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: 5 December  Business Secretary Kwasi Kwarteng visits North East England where thousands of homes remain without power more than a week after Storm Arwen. The Army and Royal Marines continue to deliver supplies to affected residents, as power firms work to repair the last outages.

links.text: -"Storm Arwen: Business secretary says power cuts unacceptable". BBC News. 5 December 2021. Retrieved 5 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: 6 December  COVID-19 in the UK Sajid Javid confirms that community transmission of the Omicron variant, i.e. not linked to international travel, is occurring across multiple regions.

links.text: -"Health secretary says Omicron spreading in the community". BBC News. 6 December 2021. Retrieved 6 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: 7 December  Severe weather warnings are issued for most of the UK as Storm Barra makes landfall.

links.text: -"Storm Barra: Weather warnings for most of UK as gales and rain hit". BBC News. 7 December 2021. Retrieved 7 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: COVID-19 in the UK "Plan B" is announced by Boris Johnson, which introduces further restrictions on social gatherings. This includes a requirement to work from home wherever possible, the use of face coverings extended to include more venues, and the NHS Covid Pass or a negative lateral flow test for entry to crowded events (subject to parliamentary approval).

links.text: -"Omicron: What are the new Plan B rules for England?". BBC News. 8 December 2021. Retrieved 9 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: COVID-19 vaccination in the UK The booster jab program opens to over-40s, meaning an extra seven million people can get a third vaccine dose.

links.text: -"Covid booster jab booking system opens to over-40s in England". BBC News. 8 December 2021. Retrieved 8 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: Former Downing Street Press Secretary Allegra Stratton resigns as government spokesperson for COP26, after footage emerges of her and colleagues during a mock press conference on 22 , making joking references to an alleged Christmas gathering in 10 Downing Street four days earlier. Boris Johnson apologises for the video in the House of Commons during Prime Minister's Questions, with opposition parties criticising him. An investigation is launched by Simon Case.

links.text: -"Debacle over No 10 Christmas party 'threatens efforts to control pandemic'". The Guardian. 9 December 2021. Retrieved 9 December 2021.-
-"Downing Street party: Investigation could be widened, says Sajid Javid". BBC News. 9 December 2021. Retrieved 9 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: The Conservative Party is fined Â£17,800 by the Electoral Commission after failing to accurately report a donation that paid for Johnson's flat refurbishment, and for failing to keep a proper accounting record.

links.text: -"Conservative Party fined over PM's Downing Street flat refurbishment". BBC News. 9 December 2021. Retrieved 9 December 2021.-
-"Conservative Party fined for inaccurate donation report". Electoral Commission. 9 December 2021. Retrieved 9 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: The official investigation into government staff parties, alleged to have taken place during lockdown in late 2020, is widened to include a total of three events. Labour calls for Johnson to resign if he is found to have misled Parliament on the issue.

links.text: -"Christmas parties row: Three gatherings to be investigated by top civil servant". BBC News. 9 December 2021. Retrieved 9 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: Longannet power station, the last remaining coal-fired power station in Scotland, is demolished.

links.text: -"Scotland marks end to coal power as Longannet chimney is blown up". The Guardian. 9 December 2021. Retrieved 10 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: The High Court rules that WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange can be extradited from the UK to the US.

links.text: -"Julian Assange can be extradited to the US, court rules". BBC News. 10 December 2021. Retrieved 10 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: COVID-19 in the UK The daily infection number reaches the highest level since January, at 58,194.

links.text: -"UK Covid cases hit highest daily total since January". BBC News. 10 December 2021. Retrieved 10 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: The Daily Mirror publishes a leaked photo of Johnson at a virtual Christmas quiz in Downing Street on 15 , sitting in-person with two colleagues, when London was under COVID-19 lockdown rules that prohibited household mixing.

links.text: -"PM Boris Johnson took part in No 10 Christmas quiz last year". BBC News. 12 December 2021. Retrieved 12 December 2021.-
-"Boris Johnson pictured hosting No 10 Christmas quiz last year". The Guardian. 11 December 2021. Retrieved 12 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: The COVID alert level is increased to four, meaning transmission is "high or rising exponentially", due to a rapid increase in Omicron cases. An additional 1,239 Omicron cases are reported, marking the biggest daily rise to date and bringing the total confirmed number in the UK to 3,137.

links.text: -"Covid: UK alert level raised to four due to Omicron". BBC News. 12 December 2021. Retrieved 12 December 2021.-
-"UK confirms additional 1,239 Omicron cases, marking biggest daily rise to date". The Guardian. 12 December 2021. Retrieved 12 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: In a televised address, Johnson warns of "a tidal wave of Omicron coming" as he brings forward a target to give all over-18s a booster jab by one month to the end of December. This will mean the booster jab rollout needing to increase to a million a day, he explains, nearly doubling the current 530,000 daily figure.

links.text: -"UK booster jab rollout to increase to 1m a day to battle Omicron 'tidal wave'". The Guardian. 12 December 2021. Retrieved 13 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: Campaign Against Antisemitism organise a demonstration outside Broadcasting House to protest against the BBC's coverage of a recent antisemitic attack on Oxford Street.

links.text: -"Community holds anti-BBC protest over Chanukah bus attack coverage". Jewish News. 14 December 2021. Retrieved 21 February 2023.-

Data.event_text: The first UK death from the Omicron variant is reported.

links.text: -"Covid: First UK death recorded with Omicron variant". BBC News. 13 December 2021. Retrieved 13 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: Shortages of lateral flow tests are reported.

links.text: -"COVID-19: Rapid lateral flow home testing kits have run out on government's website". Sky News. 13 December 2021. Retrieved 13 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: 14 December  COVID-19 in the UK Passes for entry to large venues like nightclubs in England win the backing of MPs by 369 votes to 126, despite a rebellion by Conservative backbenchers.

links.text: -"Commons backs Covid passes by 369 votes to 126". BBC News. 14 December 2021. Retrieved 14 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: Inflation reaches 5.1%, up from 4.2% the previous month and its highest level in 10 years.

links.text: -"Inflation hits 10-year high as energy, fuel and clothing costs jump". BBC News. 15 December 2021. Retrieved 15 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: A leaked photo emerges of former London mayoral candidate Shaun Bailey and 23 colleagues holding a gathering at the Conservative headquarters in London, during the COVID-19 restrictions of , provoking allegations that the restrictions had been broken. However, on 11 November 2022, the police clear Bailey, and all others in attendance at the gathering, of any wrongdoing.

links.text: -"Conservative Christmas party was unacceptable, says Grant Shapps". BBC News. 15 December 2021. Retrieved 15 December 2021.-
-"Canapes and party hats in CCHQ: Boris Johnson's latest photo nightmare". The Guardian. 15 December 2021. Retrieved 15 December 2021.-
-"Covid lockdown: No police action over Shaun Bailey Tory event". BBC News. 11 November 2022. Retrieved 11 November 2022.-

Data.event_text: COVID-19 in the UK The UK records its highest number of daily cases since the pandemic began, at 78,610.

links.text: -"Covid: UK reports highest daily cases since the pandemic began". BBC News. 15 December 2021. Retrieved 15 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: The Bank of England raises interest rates for the first time in more than three years, from 0.1% to 0.25%, in response to surging inflation.

links.text: -"Bank of England raises interest rates to 0.25%". BBC News. 16 December 2021. Retrieved 16 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: 2021 North Shropshire by-election Liberal Democrats candidate Helen Morgan wins the seat vacated by Owen Paterson. The swing of 34.16% is the seventh largest in UK by-election history and the seat had been held by Conservatives since 1906.

links.text: -"Tories lose North Shropshire seat they held for nearly 200 years". BBC News. 17 December 2021. Retrieved 17 December 2021.-
-Grylls, George (15 December 2021). "North Shropshire by-election: Christmas party scandal could affect result, Tory candidate admits". The Times.-

Data.event_text: 17 December  Simon Case recuses himself from his role of leading an inquiry into alleged government staff parties during lockdown, after it is reported that a similar event was also held in his own office.

links.text: -"Top civil servant Simon Case quits No 10 party probe amid rule breach claims". BBC News. 17 December 2021. Retrieved 17 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: COVID-19 in the UK London Mayor Sadiq Khan declares a major incident in the capital, due to the rapid spread of the Omicron variant.

links.text: -"Covid: London 'major incident' declared due to Omicron rise". BBC News. 18 December 2021. Retrieved 18 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: Lord Frost resigns as Minister of State for the Cabinet Office, citing "concerns about the current direction of travel" of the government.

links.text: -"Lord Frost resigns as Brexit minister". BBC News. 18 December 2021. Retrieved 19 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: Piers Corbyn is arrested by the Metropolitan Police after a video emerges of him urging people to "hammer to death those scum, those scum who have decided to go ahead with introducing new fascism", as well as suggesting that the offices of MPs who had voted for COVID-19 restrictions should be burned down.

links.text: -"Piers Corbyn arrested over video calling for arson". BBC News. 19 December 2021. Retrieved 19 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: The Guardian publishes a photo of Boris Johnson, his wife, and 17 staff members in the Downing Street garden with cheese and wine in May 2020, at a time when large social gatherings were prohibited due to COVID-19. Johnson's spokesman tells the newspaper that the photo shows a work meeting, not a social event.

links.text: -"Boris Johnson and staff pictured with wine in Downing Street garden in May 2020". The Guardian. 19 December 2021. Retrieved 20 December 2021.-
-"Covid-19: No 10 says garden photo shows work meeting". BBC News. 20 December 2021. Retrieved 20 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: Hornsea Two Wind Farm, the world's largest offshore array, is reported to be generating power for the first time.

links.text: -"World's Biggest Offshore Wind Farm Generates First Power". The Maritime Executive. 20 December 2021. Retrieved 21 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: Another record high of 106,122 new infections is reported, the first time the daily case number has exceeded 100,000.

links.text: -"Daily Covid-19 cases in the UK exceed 100,000 for first time". BBC News. 22 December 2021. Retrieved 22 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: Preliminary studies of the Omicron variant suggest that it could be milder than Delta, with a 30% to 70% reduction in those needing hospital treatment; however, the increased transmissibility may still overwhelm hospitals, through the sheer number of cases.

links.text: -"Omicron wave appears milder, but concern remains". BBC News. 22 December 2021. Retrieved 22 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: 23 December  COVID-19 in the UK Another record high of 119,789 new infections is reported.

links.text: -"UK records 119,789 new Covid cases in one day, its highest total ever". The Guardian. 23 December 2021. Retrieved 23 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: 28 December  COVID-19 in the UK Another record high of 129,471 new infections is reported.

links.text: -"UK sets new record of more than 129,000 Covid cases in a day". The Guardian. 28 December 2021. Retrieved 28 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: COVID-19 in the UK Another record high of 189,213 new infections is reported, which includes a five-day Christmas backlog for Northern Ireland, and a two-day backlog for Wales.

links.text: -"UK Covid case numbers hit another record high at more than 189,000". The Guardian. 30 December 2021. Retrieved 31 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: A 16-year-old boy dies after being stabbed in Hillingdon, West London, making him the 30th teenage homicide in the capital during 2021, surpassing the previous record high of 29 in 2008.

links.text: -"Boy becomes 30th teenage homicide victim in London this year â€“ a new record". Sky News. 31 December 2021. Retrieved 31 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: Paxlovid is approved by the UK medicines regulator, becoming the second new antiviral pill for Covid in the UK after molnupiravir.

links.text: -"Paxlovid: UK medicines regulator approves second Covid antiviral pill". BBC News. 31 December 2021. Retrieved 31 December 2021.-
-"Oral COVID-19 antiviral, Paxlovid, approved by UK regulator". Gov.uk. 31 December 2021. Retrieved 31 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: Another record high of 189,846 new infections is reported, as the seven day cumulative total exceeds 1 million.

links.text: -"Covid: UK cases reach record again as PM urges New Year's Eve caution". BBC News. 31 December 2021. Retrieved 31 December 2021.-

Data.event_text: Many public New Year's Eve celebrations are cancelled, including Hogmanay in Scotland, due to the prevalence of COVID-19.

links.text: -"Fireworks and Big Ben mark subdued UK new year amid Covid spread". BBC News. 1 January 2022. Retrieved 1 January 2022.-

Data.event_text: The warmest New Year's Eve on record is reported, with temperatures of 15.8Â Â°C (60.4Â Â°F) in western England.

links.text: -"Warmest New Year's Eve recorded in Somerset ushers in 2022". BBC News. 31 December 2021. Retrieved 1 January 2022.-

Data.event_text: The newly restored clock face of Big Ben is revealed in time for the new year, following a renovation that began in 2017.

links.text: -"Restored Big Ben to bong again at midnight to bring in new year". The Guardian. 31 December 2021. Retrieved 1 January 2022.-
